item.title: UK fines software provider £3.07 million for 2022 ransomware breach
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The UK Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) has fined Advanced Computer Software Group Ltd £3.07 million over a 2022 ransomware attack that exposed the sensitive personal data of 79,404 people, including National Health Service (NHS) patients. [...]

item.title: Oracle customers confirm data stolen in alleged cloud breach is valid
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Despite Oracle denying a breach of its Oracle Cloud federated SSO login servers and the theft of account data for 6 million people, BleepingComputer has confirmed with multiple companies that associated data samples shared by the threat actor are valid. [...]

item.title: StreamElements discloses third-party data breach after hacker leaks data
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Cloud-based streaming company StreamElements confirms it suffered a data breach at a third-party service provider after a threat actor leaked samples of stolen data on a hacking forum. [...]

item.title: New Atlantis AIO platform automates credential stuffing on 140 services
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new cybercrime platform named 'Atlantis AIO' provides an automated credential stuffing service against 140 online platforms, including email services, e-commerce sites, banks, and VPNs. [...]

item.title: Claude is testing ChatGPT-like Deep Research feature Compass
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Claude could be getting a ChatGPT-like Deep Research feature called Compass. You can tell Claude's Compass what you need, and the AI agent will take care of everything. [...]

item.title: The 7 technology trends that could replace passwords
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Specops Software
item.description: 230M stolen passwords met complexity requirements—and were still compromised. Passwords aren't going away for now, but there are new technologies that may increasingly replace them. Learn more from Specops Software about how to protect your passwords. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes printing issues caused by January Windows updates
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has fixed a known issue causing some USB printers to start printing random text after installing Windows updates released since late January 2025. [...]

item.title: RedCurl cyberspies create ransomware to encrypt Hyper-V servers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A threat actor named 'RedCurl,' known for stealthy corporate espionage operations since 2018, is now using a ransomware encryptor designed to target Hyper-V virtual machines. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Recent Windows updates cause Remote Desktop issues
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says that some customers might experience Remote Desktop and RDS connection issues after installing recent Windows updates released since January 2025. [...]

item.title: New npm attack poisons local packages with backdoors
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Two malicious packages were discovered on npm (Node package manager) that covertly patch legitimate, locally installed packages to inject a persistent reverse shell backdoor. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 update breaks Veeam recovery, causes connection errors
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft and Veeam are investigating a known issue that triggers connection errors on Windows 11 24H2 systems when restoring from Veeam Recovery Media. [...]

item.title: Google fixes Chrome zero-day exploited in espionage campaign
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Google has fixed a high-severity Chrome zero-day vulnerability exploited to escape the browser's sandbox and deploy malware in espionage attacks targeting Russian media outlets and government organizations. [...]

item.title: CrushFTP warns users to patch unauthenticated access flaw immediately
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CrushFTP warned customers of an unauthenticated HTTP(S) port access vulnerability and urged them to patch their servers immediately. [...]
